definition: it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
lit. to be hardly worth eating, but it would still be a pity to discard it (idiom)/fig. some things have little to no value, yet one is still reluctant to part with them
pinyin: shi2 zhi1 wu2 wei4 , qi4 zhi1 ke3 xi1

sentences.english: Instead, he fell victim to his faith in the anti-fat propaganda.
sentences.chinese: 很可惜，他成了“反對脂肪”宣傳的犧牲品。

sentences.english: But that isn't something worth celebrating, at least not for Chinese mayors.
sentences.chinese: 可惜這並不值得慶祝，至少對於中國的市長們是如此。

sentences.english: He did rather well, but he failed to break the record.
sentences.chinese: 他幹得不錯，可惜沒破紀錄。

sentences.english: It was a pity that his sea power kingdom was not complete then he passed away.
sentences.chinese: 可惜他的海權王國並未完成，便與世長辭了。

sentences.english: But for every success, there are dozens of failures.
sentences.chinese: 可惜成功總是與失敗如影隨形。

sentences.english: Watching movies is fun, but the ticket prices never go down.
sentences.chinese: 看電影真愉快，可惜票價下不來。

sentences.english: Putting back after the new, she also published, but no harvest.
sentences.chinese: 回新後，她還刊登了尋人啓事，可惜都沒有收穫。

sentences.english: He was an unrivalled talent, but unfortunately at the wrong time.
sentences.chinese: 他是個舉世無雙的奇才，可惜生不逢時。

sentences.english: Too bad they couldn't come up with a better band.
sentences.chinese: 可惜，他們沒能請到一支較好的樂隊。

sentences.english: Its a shame you had to go so fast but take care anyway.
sentences.chinese: 真可惜你那麼快又要走了，不管怎樣，一路保重。

sentences.english: Sadly, the mansion nowadays is found on no map.
sentences.chinese: 可惜的是，這座公館現在沒法在地圖中找到。

sentences.english: They'll simply assume that, pathetically, you've never been able to quit.
sentences.chinese: 可惜的是，他們只會認爲，你從未能把煙戒失蹤。

sentences.english: Pity, because a Secularist could probably do a bang up job.
sentences.chinese: 可惜的是，世俗主義者可能出昏招。

sentences.english: Alas, its barrels hold only rubber bullets and darts.
sentences.chinese: 只可惜，他的槍管裏裝的是橡皮子彈和飛鏢。

sentences.english: “Shame on you, baby, shame on you,” Ms.DeVoe said.
sentences.chinese: “寶貝，真爲你感到可惜，”DeVoe女士說道。

sentences.english: The procession has turned onto Lianyue Rd. Too bad Lian Yue's not here.
sentences.chinese: 現隊伍轉入蓮嶽路，可惜連嶽不在。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
to regret/to feel that it is a great pity/to feel sorry for sb
to do something to sb/to deal with/to cope/how?/to no avail
contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
